translated: and it will be the great protection.🔽Having made a cupped pair of hands with the ring fingers and little fingers inserted inside, one should extend the two little fingers outside with the tips touching, and bend the two ring fingers on top of them, placing the two thumbs slightly not touching.

original: gung mo gnyis sbyar nas bsgreng ba de'i logs kyi tshigs gsum bar mdzub mo cung zad bkug pas bkod pa ni zla med pa zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya'o //

translated: Having joined the two middle fingers and extended them, one should place the two index fingers slightly bent on the third joint of those [middle fingers]. This is the mudrā called without equal.

original: sngags ni na ma: sa manta badzra n'am aom ham h'um phat /
analyzed: sngags ni na ma: sa manta badzra n'am aom ham h'um phat /
translated: The mantra is: namaḥ samantabuddhānāṃ oṃ haṃ hūṃ phaṭ.🔽

original: y'a sa he h'um phat /
analyzed: y'a sa he h'um phat /

original: de nas ni go cha chen po'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de nas ni go cha chen po'i phyag rgya ste /

original: rdo rje mi thub pa'i go cha bgo bar bya ba /
analyzed: rdo rje mi thub pa'i go cha bgo bar bya ba /
translated: One should don the armor of the invincible vajra.

original: mthe'u chung gnyis dang mthe bong gnyis lu gu rgyud kyi rnam pa gzhan rnams kyi rtsa ba dang bar dang rtse mo legs par sbyang ba ni rdo rje mi thub pa'o //🔽sngags ni nam: sa manta /
analyzed: mthe'u chung gnyis dang mthe bong gnyis lu gu rgyud kyi rnam pa gzhan rnams kyi rtsa ba dang bar dang rtse mo legs par sbyang ba ni rdo rje mi thub pa'o // sngags ni nam: sa manta /
translated: The two little fingers and two thumbs in the form of a chain, the others at the base, middle, and tip well-trained, is the invincible vajra.

analyzed: badzra n'am aom ham h'um badzra ba ye ba ka ba tse ho badzra badzra h'um phat /

original: de ltar bdud la sogs pa rnams kyis ches shin tu yang brdzi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bdud la sogs pa rnams kyis ches shin tu yang brdzi bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: de ltar bdag srung ba byas nas gnas bsrung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar bdag srung ba byas nas gnas bsrung bar bya ste /

translated: The mudra of Vajra Seat is to sit cross-legged and place the right palm facing up on the back of the left palm, which is facing down.🔽The mantra is:

original: sngags ni / na ma: samanta badzra n'am aom ham h'um badzra ne pam h'um phat /
analyzed: sngags ni / na ma: samanta badzra n'am aom ham h'um badzra ne pam h'um phat /

analyzed: de nas rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgyas bdag @165a * // nyid kyi gnas /
translated: Then, with the mudra of the vajra maṇḍala, bless one’s place

original: rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab par bya ste /🔽thal mo mnyam par sbyar ba mdzub mo gnyis dang srin lag gnyis kyi tshigs dbus ma bcag nas nang du bkug ste legs par bcug pas ka ba'i rnam par ro //

translated: as having the nature of vajra.🔽The mudra of the vajra maṇḍala is to join the palms together, bend the two index fingers and the two ring fingers at the middle joint, and insert them well inside, making the shape of a pillar.

original: lhag ma khab kyi rnam par bya ba ni rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma khab kyi rnam par bya ba ni rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The remaining fingers are made into the shape of needles.🔽The mantra is:

analyzed: sngags ni / na ma: sa manta badzr'a n'am aom ham h'um badzr'a gra bhu ba ne lom aom h'um phat /

original: da ni rdo rje ra ba yin pas /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje ra ba yin pas /
translated: Now, with the vajra fence,

original: de'i phyag rgya dgod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya dgod par bya ste /

analyzed: sngags ni / nam: sa manta badzra n'am aom ham h'um badzra manda le bandha bandha h'um phat /

original: de nas de'i steng du rdo rje'i gur yin pas de'i phyag rgya dgod par bya ste /🔽thal mo mnyam du sbyor la srin lag gnyis dang mdzub mo gnyis rgyab sprad la nang du dgug go ;

analyzed: / gung mo rtse sprad la bsgreng de bzhin du mthe'u chung dang mthe ba mo dag kyang byas pa ni gur gyi phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: de nas phyi rol du rdo rje 'bar ba ste /

original: de'i phyag rgya dgod par bya ba ni /

translated: Then, imagine that the buddhas and bodhisattvas who purify all world systems are satisfied by the ocean of clouds of melodious sounds endowed with various qualities and by the ocean of clouds of the melodious sounds of the Dharma.

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' chen po la phyag 'tshal zhing bstod do //
translated: Homage and praise to great Vajrasattva!

original: sems can la phan ba mdzad pas bzhugs su gsol /
analyzed: sems can la phan ba mdzad pas bzhugs su gsol /
translated: Please remain to benefit sentient beings!

original: thams cad la chos rnams thams cad byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
analyzed: thams cad la chos rnams thams cad byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
translated: Please bless all phenomena for all!

analyzed: sv'a h'a mchod pa la sogs pa de dag rnams thams cad sngags la sogs pa'i stobs kyi phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes dad par bya ba'o //
translated: All of these offerings and so forth are not mistaken due to the power of the mantra and so forth.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de rnams kyang 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de rnams kyang 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
translated: One should dedicate those roots of virtue in this way to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment:

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rjes su mkhyen pa'i yongs su bsngo bar gyur pa de ltar bdag gis kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rjes su mkhyen pa'i yongs su bsngo bar gyur pa de ltar bdag gis kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo bar bgyi'o //
translated: Just as the Blessed Buddhas know, in the same way I dedicate those roots of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis kyang bdag kun du bzang po'i spyod pas byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas te sems can thams cad kyang kun du bzang po'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa la rab tu dgod par bya'o zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis kyang bdag kun du bzang po'i spyod pas byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas te sems can thams cad kyang kun du bzang po'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa la rab tu dgod par bya'o zhes bya bar ro //
translated: By these roots of virtue, may I attain perfect enlightenment through the conduct of Samantabhadra, and may I establish all sentient beings in the pure conduct of Samantabhadra.

original: de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad kyi byin rlabs 'byung bar bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad kyi byin rlabs 'byung bar bya ba'i don du /
translated: Then, in order to cause the blessings of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas to arise,

original: de'i phyag rgya bcings la sngar bshad pa'i yi ge brgya pa dran par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya bcings la sngar bshad pa'i yi ge brgya pa dran par bya'o //
translated: one should form the seal of that [buddha or bodhisattva] and recall the hundred-syllable mantra as explained before.

original: yang na yi ge lnga pa'o //
analyzed: yang na yi ge lnga pa'o //
translated: Or else, [one should recall] the five-syllable [mantra].

original: lag pa gnyis phan tshun du rgyab sbrel bas gshibs pa'i sor mo'i rtse mo gyen du bstan la mdzub mo gnyis dang mthe'u chung gnyis kyang lu gu rgyud du dgod cing gung mo gnyis dang srin lag dag kyang bsgreng ba'i bar du mthe bong gnyis bcug pa kha
analyzed: lag pa gnyis phan tshun du rgyab sbrel bas gshibs pa'i sor mo'i rtse mo gyen du bstan la mdzub mo gnyis dang mthe'u chung gnyis kyang lu gu rgyud du dgod cing gung mo gnyis dang srin lag dag kyang bsgreng ba'i bar du mthe bong gnyis bcug pa kha
translated: The tips of the fingers of the two hands are extended upward, the two index fingers and two little fingers are arranged in a chain, and the two middle fingers and ring fingers are also extended upward. The two thumbs are inserted between [the middle and ring fingers],

original: gyen du bstan la bzung ba ni yi ge brgya pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: gyen du bstan la bzung ba ni yi ge brgya pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: and [the hands] are held upright. This is the seal of the hundred-syllable [mantra].

original: yi ge lnga pa'i phyag rgya yang /
analyzed: yi ge lnga pa'i phyag rgya yang /
translated: The seal of the five-syllable [mantra] is also [formed]

original: thal mo kha sbyar du byas te mdzub mo gnyis kyis mthe bong gnyis rtse mo la reg par byas la lhag ma ni de kho na nyid bzhin du khab kyi rnam par ro //
analyzed: thal mo kha sbyar du byas te mdzub mo gnyis kyis mthe bong gnyis rtse mo la reg par byas la lhag ma ni de kho na nyid bzhin du khab kyi rnam par ro //
translated: by joining the palms together, with the two index fingers touching the tips of the two thumbs, and the rest [of the fingers] in the form of a needle just like [the seal of] reality.

original: sngags ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sngags ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: a'a b'i ra h'um kham /
analyzed: a'a b'i ra h'um kham /
translated: Om vajra-mudra-bandha-bandha.

original: da ni phyag rgya thams cad yang dag par sdud par gyur pa kun du snang bar byed pa gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'am chos kyi 'khor lo'i bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: da ni phyag rgya thams cad yang dag par sdud par gyur pa kun du snang bar byed pa gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'am chos kyi 'khor lo'i bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Now, one should bind the uṣṇīṣa mudrā or the Dharma-cakra mudrā, which is the universal illuminator that gathers together all the mudrās.

original: lag pa gnyis mnyam por bkan nas brkyang la @167a * //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis mnyam por bkan nas brkyang la @167a * //
translated: One should extend both hands with the fingers straight and even.

original: srin lag dang mdzub mo lag pa'i nang du sen mos sen mo gtugs pa la mthe bong gi rtse mo dgug go //
analyzed: srin lag dang mdzub mo lag pa'i nang du sen mos sen mo gtugs pa la mthe bong gi rtse mo dgug go //
translated: The ring fingers and index fingers should touch fingertip to fingertip inside the hands. The tips of the thumbs should be bent.

original: mthe'u chung ni rtse sbrang la sbyar te brkyang ngo /
analyzed: mthe'u chung ni rtse sbrang la sbyar te brkyang ngo /
translated: The little fingers should be extended, joined at the tips.

original: gung mo ni de kho na ltar sen mo'i rtse mo mnyam por slang ngo //
analyzed: gung mo ni de kho na ltar sen mo'i rtse mo mnyam por slang ngo //
translated: The middle fingers should be extended with the tips of the fingernails even.

original: kun du snang bar byed pa gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: kun du snang bar byed pa gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the uṣṇīṣa mudrā, the universal illuminator.

original: de nyid la mdzub mo bshugs la sen mos sen mo la cung ma reg pa'i mandala gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid la mdzub mo bshugs la sen mos sen mo la cung ma reg pa'i mandala gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: For that same [mudrā], one should extend the index fingers so that the tips of the fingernails do not quite touch, in the shape of a maṇḍala.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the Dharma-wheel seal.

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di dag gnyis kyi sngags ni /
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di dag gnyis kyi sngags ni /
translated: The two mantras of these two, in the proper order, are:

original: a'a: mam ham /
analyzed: a'a: mam ham /
translated: AḤ MAṂ HAṂ.

original: aom dyun pa ta yatstsha na ta tsa kre na badzri n'a h'um /
analyzed: aom dyun pa ta yatstsha na ta tsa kre na badzri n'a h'um /
translated: OṂ DHYAṆAPAṬAYA CCHAṆATACAKREṇa VAJRIṆĀ HŪṂ.

original: 'di dag gnyis gang yang rung ba bcings la sngags lan cig brjod la 'gro ba'am 'dug pas kyang bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gnyis gang yang rung ba bcings la sngags lan cig brjod la 'gro ba'am 'dug pas kyang bzlas par bya ste /
translated: Having bound either of these two, one should go or stay, reciting the mantra once.

original: bdud la sogs pas zil gyis non par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud la sogs pas zil gyis non par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not be overcome by Māra and so forth.

original: dngos grub rnams kyang 'di la mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos grub rnams kyang 'di la mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: One will also have success in this.

original: myur du 'grub par bya ba'i don du de nas chos 'byung gi phyag rgya bcings la de'i sngags brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: myur du 'grub par bya ba'i don du de nas chos 'byung gi phyag rgya bcings la de'i sngags brjod par bya'o //
translated: For the sake of swift accomplishment, one should then form the Dharma-source seal and recite its mantra.

original: lag pa g-yon pa khu tshur bcangs la mdzub mo dang mthe'u chung dang mthe bo rnams gyen du brkyang bar bya ba ni chos 'byung gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa khu tshur bcangs la mdzub mo dang mthe'u chung dang mthe bo rnams gyen du brkyang bar bya ba ni chos 'byung gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The left hand is made into a fist, with the index finger, little finger, and thumb extended upward—this is the Dharma-source seal.

original: sngags ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sngags ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas!

original: a'a: sa ra pa th'a sar pa tra na ke sv'a h'a /
analyzed: a'a: sa ra pa th'a sar pa tra na ke sv'a h'a /
translated: Aum sarva-pâpa-desanâya siddham svâhâ.

original: rang gi phyag rgya dang sngags kyang lan cig brjod pas dam tshig brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya dang sngags kyang lan cig brjod pas dam tshig brtan par bya'o //
translated: One should also recite one's own mantra and seal, and thereby stabilize the vow.

original: rang gi phyag rgya rnams kyang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya rnams kyang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should also know one's own seals as appropriate.

original: de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la yan lag lngas phyag 'tshal bar dmigs shing bzlas pa goms pas ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i sngags rnams myur bar ma yin bul bar ma yin pa'i rtog pa spangs la sngags kyi yi ge rig pa'i
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la yan lag lngas phyag 'tshal bar dmigs shing bzlas pa goms pas ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i sngags rnams myur bar ma yin bul bar ma yin pa'i rtog pa spangs la sngags kyi yi ge rig pa'i
translated: Then, visualizing oneself as prostrating with the five limbs to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, and familiarizing oneself with the recitation, one should recite the mantras as desired, not too quickly, not too slowly, abandoning discursive thought.

original: sems kyis ji srid du skyo bar ma gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyis ji srid du skyo bar ma gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: With the mind of wisdom, one should recite the mantra syllables as long as one does not become weary.

original: de nas langs te de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po lan cig brjod la 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa la sogs pa'i mdo dag gdon par bya'o ;
analyzed: de nas langs te de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po lan cig brjod la 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa la sogs pa'i mdo dag gdon par bya'o ;
translated: Then, having risen, one should recite the Essence of the Tathagata once, and recite the noble Sutra of the Arrayed Stalks, and so forth.

original: / tha mar mchod cing phyag btsal la zas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: / tha mar mchod cing phyag btsal la zas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: In the end, one should make offerings, prostrate, and eat food.

original: za ba na yang sngags 'dis lan brgyad du mngon par bsngags te dang po'i cha ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la lha bshos su byas la 'bring po'i tshad du bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: za ba na yang sngags 'dis lan brgyad du mngon par bsngags te dang po'i cha ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la lha bshos su byas la 'bring po'i tshad du bza' bar bya'o //
translated: While eating, one should consecrate with this mantra eight times. The first portion is for the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, and one should eat the middle portion.

original: de la sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mantra is as follows:

original: @167b sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: @167b sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas!

original: aom stobs sbyin pa'i gzi brjid kyi phreng ba sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom stobs sbyin pa'i gzi brjid kyi phreng ba sv'a h'a /
translated: Om, give me strength, give me splendor, give me glory, svâhâ!

original: zos pa'i lhag ma yang 'phags pa mi g-yo ba gtum po don yod pa'i snying pos lan cig mngon par bsngags la lhag ma'i chang bu sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: zos pa'i lhag ma yang 'phags pa mi g-yo ba gtum po don yod pa'i snying pos lan cig mngon par bsngags la lhag ma'i chang bu sbyin par bya ste /
translated: One should also give the remainder of the food, consecrated once with the noble Amoghapâśa’s essence mantra, as a bali offering.

original: rtag tu rjes su 'brel pa rnams kyis blang bar dngos grub ster bar byed do //
analyzed: rtag tu rjes su 'brel pa rnams kyis blang bar dngos grub ster bar byed do //
translated: Those who are always connected with it will be granted powers.

original: zos pa ngal sos nas kyang sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas te /
analyzed: zos pa ngal sos nas kyang sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas te /
translated: Having rested after eating, one should confess one's sins and so forth,

original: dam pa'i chos la dga' ba nyid kyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la dga' ba nyid kyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: and one should abide in delight in the holy Dharma.

original: gal te nus par gyur na phyi dro yang srung ba la sogs pa yan lag dang bcas pa dang mchod pa la sogs pa de dag thams cad byas la bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nus par gyur na phyi dro yang srung ba la sogs pa yan lag dang bcas pa dang mchod pa la sogs pa de dag thams cad byas la bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: If one is able, one should do all of those, such as the protection wheel in the evening, and so forth, and do the recitation.

original: mi nus na snga dro byas pa nyid kyi srung ba la sogs pa gshegs su ma gsol bar gnas pa nyid kyis bsam pa brtan par byas la /
analyzed: mi nus na snga dro byas pa nyid kyi srung ba la sogs pa gshegs su ma gsol bar gnas pa nyid kyis bsam pa brtan par byas la /
translated: If one is not able, one should do it in the morning, and without requesting the dismissal of the protection wheel and so forth, one should stabilize one's intention by abiding in it.

original: 'phags pa mi g-yo rdo rje'i phyag rgya sngags dang bcas pas bgegs bskrad cing yi ge lnga pa la sogs pa gzhan gang yang rung ba phyag rgya dang bcas pas srung ba byas te /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi g-yo rdo rje'i phyag rgya sngags dang bcas pas bgegs bskrad cing yi ge lnga pa la sogs pa gzhan gang yang rung ba phyag rgya dang bcas pas srung ba byas te /
translated: One should expel obstructors with the mantra and mudra of the noble Akṣobhya Vajra, and one should perform the protection with any other [mantra], such as the five-syllable [mantra], together with the mudra.

original: mchod pa dang bstod pa la sogs pa yang nye bar blangs shing sngar bzhin du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa dang bstod pa la sogs pa yang nye bar blangs shing sngar bzhin du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should also make offerings, praises, and so forth, and recite as before.

original: nyi ma rgas pa dang ra ba dang gur la sogs pas gshegs su gsol la ;
analyzed: nyi ma rgas pa dang ra ba dang gur la sogs pas gshegs su gsol la ;
translated: When the sun sets, one should request the departure with a fence, a tent, and so forth.

original: 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i cho ga bsgo bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i cho ga bsgo bar bya ste /
translated: One should command the procedure of the garland of light rays.

original: phan tshun du sor mo sbrel bas nang du khu tshur la gung mo gnyis khab bzhin du phyir brkyang ba de'i tshigs gsum pa la mdzub mo zung gi rtse mo so sor gtad pa'i logs la mthe bong dag sbyar ba ni 'od zer phreng ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: phan tshun du sor mo sbrel bas nang du khu tshur la gung mo gnyis khab bzhin du phyir brkyang ba de'i tshigs gsum pa la mdzub mo zung gi rtse mo so sor gtad pa'i logs la mthe bong dag sbyar ba ni 'od zer phreng ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: With the fingers crossed in pairs, one makes an inner fist, and extends the two middle fingers like needles. original: sngags ni dus gsum du gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sngags ni dus gsum du gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: dam tshig chen po rtogs pa /
analyzed: dam tshig chen po rtogs pa /
translated: Realization of the great commitment.

original: mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa thams cad du mnyam par sems can rnams skyob pa /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa thams cad du mnyam par sems can rnams skyob pa /
translated: Understanding of sameness, everywhere protecting sentient beings.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu chags pa med pa sv'a h'a /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu chags pa med pa sv'a h'a /
translated: The utterly non-attached dharmadhatu svaha.

analyzed: nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la yang mi nyal bar dam pa'i chos gdon pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: In the first and last periods of the night, one should not sleep, but recite the holy Dharma and so on.

original: gung thun la yang khri spangs pa'i mal stan la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la yan lag thams cad kyis legs par phyag 'tshal ba nyid kyis nyal @168a * //
analyzed: gung thun la yang khri spangs pa'i mal stan la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la yan lag thams cad kyis legs par phyag 'tshal ba nyid kyis nyal @168a * //
translated: In the middle period, one should lie down on a bed or seat that is not too high, and go to sleep while properly prostrating with all limbs to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

analyzed: par bya'o // mkhyen du gsol ba yang bya ste sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bdag la byin gyis brlab tu gsol /

analyzed: bla na med pa'i dngos grub kyi mchog rnams kyang stsal du gsol /

analyzed: zhes so // cho ga 'di nyid kyang nyi ma re re zhing 'bum phrag bzlas pa dang ji srid du zla ba nya'i bar du ste /

analyzed: ji srid du grub pa'i rtags byung bar gyur gyi bar du'o //

translated: Then, on the full moon day, etc., fasting and lying down hungry, endowed with the vow of the fast, seated on a seat of leaves, or seated on a lump of kuśa grass,

original: mchod rten dang thang ka dang po ti dang sku gzugs la sogs pa rnams gang yang rung ba'i mdun du me tog gis kun du gang bar byas pa'i mandala byas la srung ba dang mchod pa la sogs pa yan lag dang bcas pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin
analyzed: mchod rten dang thang ka dang po ti dang sku gzugs la sogs pa rnams gang yang rung ba'i mdun du me tog gis kun du gang bar byas pa'i mandala byas la srung ba dang mchod pa la sogs pa yan lag dang bcas pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin

translated: Then, having prostrated with the five limbs to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, and having taken hold of the wheel, vajra, etc., one should recite the mantra, visualizing oneself as Samantabhadra or the body of the Tathagata, etc.,🔽with the thought of the desired attainment

original: dang khad nye bar yid la byas te /
analyzed: dang khad nye bar yid la byas te /
translated: close at hand.

translated: One should recite the mantra, visualizing the homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas,🔽and with a mind that is familiar with rejoicing in the accumulation of merit and knowledge of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas,

translated: from the time of the full moon until midnight or sunrise.

analyzed: de dag las kyang 'khor lo la sogs pa gdon mi za bar 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And from that, the wheel, etc. will certainly blaze forth.

analyzed: 'bar ba las kyang sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang 'dra bar ltas chen por gyur pa nam mkha' las me tog gi char 'bab @168b pa dang rnga dun du'i sgra dang lha rdzas kyi dbyangs dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: Just like the appearance of a buddha in the world, great omens occur, such as a rain of flowers falling from the sky, the sound of the Dundubhi drum, the sound of divine music, and the Tathāgatas saying “Excellent!”🔽and so forth.

original: dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing g-yo ba la sogs pa ngo mtshar ba rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing g-yo ba la sogs pa ngo mtshar ba rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: The buddha realm shakes and so forth, and all these amazing things occur.

analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa'i rigs thams cad kyang legs par 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All the families of knowledge holders gather well.

analyzed: de dag rnams kyis kyang dbang bskur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They also confer empowerment.

translated: He will please the buddhas and bodhisattvas in all the world systems, and will possess the five superknowledges. He will be a king of knowledge-bearers who practices the bodhisattva conduct, and will delight all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa'i 'khor mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa dang bde ba rjes su 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will have an infinite retinue of knowledge-bearers, and his happiness will increase.

original: 'on kyang lus de nyid nyams par yang mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'on kyang lus de nyid nyams par yang mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Moreover, his body will not deteriorate.

original: lus de nyid kho nas mngon du tshogs nye bar bsags te byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams thams cad yang dag par bgrod cing ji srid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: lus de nyid kho nas mngon du tshogs nye bar bsags te byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams thams cad yang dag par bgrod cing ji srid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du'o //
translated: With that very body, he will accumulate the collections in the presence of the buddhas, and will traverse all the bodhisattva levels until he fully awakens to highest genuine full Awakening.

translated: Moreover, all mundane and supramundane powers, such as seeing the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the wish-fulfilling gem, the excellent vase, and so forth, are accomplished by this very method.

original: bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the general and specific chapters, or having properly examined the tantra according to the ritual, one should definitely accomplish them without doubt.

original: nges pa kho nar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa kho nar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will definitely attain accomplishment.

analyzed: 'di ni thabs dang ldan pa'i sgrub thabs kyi cho ga yin la / thabs dang bral bas kyang bsgrub par bya ba yin pas /
translated: This is the ritual of the means of accomplishment endowed with means.🔽Even without means, one should not be discouraged, thinking, I am not capable of what has been explained.

analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa rnams ni bdag gis nus pa ma yin no zhes zhum par mi bya bar tha mar na bdag nyid gcig pu srung ba tsam bya ste /

analyzed: mtshams bcad pa dang mchod pa la sogs pa rnams ni bsam par bya zhing de dag gi sngags brjod la /

analyzed: ji srid 'dod kyi bar du bzlas par bya'o //

analyzed: bsgrubs par gyur na brtson 'grus kyi rjes su mthun pa dang las kyi rjes su mthun par nges pa kho nar 'grub pa yin te /

analyzed: dam tshig gsum gyi rgyal po 'di ni don yod par grub pa dang bar chad med par grub pa yin te /
translated: This King of the Three Pledges is Amoghasiddhi and is accomplished without obstacles.

analyzed: 'di yang sngags de dag dang cho ga gang dang gang yin pa de dang de la mkhas pas bsgrubs na 'grub pa yin no //

analyzed: 'di nyid kyang gsungs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This very one is also taught as follows:

analyzed: skye bo'i 'grul 'jug gis rab tu dben pa'i gnas su tshogs pa 'dus pa yongs su spangs shing sems can la rjes su brtse ba rnams ni /
translated: The assembly of those who are isolated in a solitary place, who have abandoned the company of people, who are compassionate to sentient beings,

translated: It is also said:

translated: There are two kinds of marvels:🔽Whatever the mantra practice may be, it will succeed accordingly.

analyzed: sbyor ba gang gis sgrub par byed pa de nyid kyis 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes so //

translated: should never have any doubt.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
